situation.title: Cross-border workers, business trips to the CZ
situation.meta_description: It is possible to travel to the Czech Republic only in strictly necessary cases. Trips to work or to do business (including commuters) are a part of this category.

content.processed:
Rules and recommendations

Cross-border workers may enter the Czech Republic without the necessity of a license to make an entry form or submit the PCR test result if they cross the state border between the Czech Republic and a neighboring state, at least once a week back and forth to work in the Czech Republic or in a neighboring Czech state in a long term time period. More information. 

It is possible to travel to the Czech Republic in cases, such as work or business-related trips without the necessity of fill in the entry form or submit the test results, only if such stay does not exceed 12 hours period. However, the obligation to wear an FFP2 class respirator (KN 95) without an exhalation valve applies during your stay in the Czech Republic. Additionally, before traveling, read the general rules for wearing protective equipment indoors and outdoors. 

If the journey for work reasons exceeds 12 hours, all current rules apply to you. 

Drivers in international freight transport are exempted from the obligation to register electronically, tests and quarantine. However, they are obliged to wear an FFP2 class respirator (CN 95) without an exhalation valve for the entire period of their stay in the Czech Republic.

Drivers in international freight transport traveling through the Czech Republic to Germany must submit a negative result of an antigen or PCR test, which is not older than 36 hours, to enter the Czech Republic (confirmation of the test can be in paper or electronic form and you can use this form of confirmation the PCR test result).

Employees of the critical infrastructure service, whose performance is in the interest of the Czech Republic, are exempted from the obligation to take the test upon arrival in the Czech Republic and do not have to remain in quarantine. However, the obligation of electronic registration and test before arrival in the Czech Republic applies to them. They must also wear an FFP2 class respirator (KN 95) without an exhalation valve at least the firsts 14 days after entering the Czech Republic.

More information can be found on the website of the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic

We also recommend checking the accommodation conditions.

In case of doubts or questions, please call the Ministry of the Interior of the Czech Republic: +420 974 801 801 (Mon - Thu: 8:00 - 16:00 and Fri: 8:00 - 12:00). Or by e-mail: cestovani.covid19@mvcr.cz. Information is available in the Czech and English languages.
